cscd211Utils

Class FileUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd211Utils.FileUtil

  • public class FileUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic FileUtil class that will be used throughout the quarter for CSCD 211.

    NOTE: All passed parameters are always final!

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private FileUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int countRecords(java.util.Scanner fin, int linesPer)
      The countRecords method counts the number of lines in the file and returns the count divided by the number of lines per record The Scanner is at the EOF and will need to be reset
      static java.io.File openInputFile(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The openInputFile method prompts the user for a filename, attempts to open that filename, if succesful a File object containing information on the file is returned.
      static java.io.File openOutputFile(java.util.Scanner kb)
      The openOutputFile method prompts the user for a filename, attempts to create and open that filename, if succesful a File object containing information on the file is returned.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileUtil

        private FileUtil()

    • Method Detail

      • countRecords

        public static int countRecords(java.util.Scanner fin,
                               int linesPer)
        The countRecords method counts the number of lines in the file and returns the count divided by the number of lines per record The Scanner is at the EOF and will need to be reset
        Parameters:
        fin - The Scanner object representing the file
        linesPer - The number of lines per each record
        Returns:
        int - Representing the number of records in the file
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the lines per record is less than or equal to 0
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the count of lines is 0

      • openInputFile

        public static java.io.File openInputFile(java.util.Scanner kb)
        The openInputFile method prompts the user for a filename, attempts to open that filename, if succesful a File object containing information on the file is returned. The carriage return is stripped from the input buffer at exit of the method.
        Parameters:
        kb - The Scanner object representing the keyboard
        Returns:
        File - Representing an object to the open file
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null

      • openOutputFile

        public static java.io.File openOutputFile(java.util.Scanner kb)
                                   throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                          java.io.IOException
        The openOutputFile method prompts the user for a filename, attempts to create and open that filename, if succesful a File object containing information on the file is returned. If the new file can't be created a FileNotFoundException is thrown.
        If a filename already exists it is deleted and a new file is created before the File object is returned. If the file can't be deleted or if the new file can't be created a FileNotFoundException is thrown.
        The input buffer is clean upon exit of the method.
        Parameters:
        kb - The Scanner object representing the keyboard
        Returns:
        File - Representing an object to the open file
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the Scanner object is null
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the existing file can't be deleted
        java.io.IOException - if the file can't be created
